data.note: Nicaragua's power sector is unbundled and distinct actors participate in the generation and distribution sectors.
data.name: The power sector has been unbundled (whether privatized or not) into distinct actors for generation, transmission, distribution and retail

data.note: Nicaragua's power sector is unbundled and distinct actors participate in the generation and distribution sectors.
data.name: There are legally separate private companies at each segment of the power system pre-retail
There is an independent transmission system that dispatches according to market dynamics and is not susceptible to state interference

data.note: The government provides subsidies for customers with monthly consumption of up to 150kWh, and forgoes taxes on customers with monthly consumption up to 300kWh. A 7% tax reduction is granted to customers that consume from 300 to 1,000kWh/month. Subsidies are also provided to users in certain regions.
data.name: Retail electricity prices aren't distorted by subsidies
There aren't significant barriers to private sector participation in generation

data.note: In Nicaragua,NI, electricity generation can be contracted through bilateral arrangements between generators and distributors and/or large consumers. The Instituto Nicaragüense de Energí­a (INE) regulates transmission and distribution with tariffs, while generators may compete freely in the market.
data.name: Consumers can choose retail suppliers or third-party power marketers in the retail power market

data.note: Nicaragua has a functioning wholesale power market.
data.name: There is a functioning competitive wholesale generation market

data.note: Nicaragua's generation sector is composed of 20 companies.
data.name: The generation market has many different actors and is not concentrated in the hands of a few players

data.note: Disnorte and Dissur control most of Nicaragua's supply market. Although there are other players, they represent less than 10% of the sector.
data.name: The supply market has many different actors and is not concentrated in the hands of a few players
